Antenna array and Beamformer Classes¶

This includes an AntArray class and beamformer classes to excite them

Created on Apr 26, 2024

@author: keith

class AntArray(xyz, units=None, antennas=None)¶

The array class is a subclass of an xyz Quant.Quants.Vector class This allows for the direct manipulation of the array element coordinates quaternion rotation and xyz offsets are directly supported,

An Array holds Antenna objects or huygen’s sources. If Antenna objects then the EMField is the total field If huygen’s sources then the EMfield is the array factor and must be multiplied times the embedded element pattern o get the total field.

The Array constructor takes the xyz coodinates of each element and an optional list of Antenna objects.

static class methods are provided to ease the construction of some common array configurations:

classmethod createPlanarArray(xNum, xInc, xOffset=0, yNum=1, yInc=0, yOffset=0, units=None, antennas=None)¶

This class method is a helper function to aid in the creation of planar and linear arrays. The array is defined in the x-y plane and must be rotated and offset as desired. Optional alternating offsets in both x and/or y along for triangular type grids.

getEMField(driveVoltages, freq, obsPts)¶

Returns an EM pattern.

if antennas==none then its marked as an array factor

property origin¶

Calculates and returns origin (center of mass)

transformToEllipsoid(edef)¶

moves array elements to surface of ellipsoid either by wrapping or projection

Created on May 31, 2024

@author: keith

class Beamformer(arrayObj)¶

this class takes an Array object and provides the base class for all Beamformers

class SimpleBF(arrayObj)¶
generateExcitations(freq, theta, phi)¶

Generates phasing so that a beam is formed in the theta, phi direction
